page.title: 07LITTLETOWN HOUSE by T.Taylor
page.content: Littletown House,built of local stone and standing in some 2 acres of land,was built in 1820 as a residence for the Owner of the newly-discovered coalmine.It remained the Owner's or Manager's house until after nationalisation in 1946,when the NCB used it as the HQ for their current Manager and staff. Littletown House is now privately owned and split into three freehold properties:Groom's Cottage,the old stable block;Main Wing and Gardener's Cottage,the previous original building;and East Wing,where I now live,consists of the servants' quarters together with an 1897 addition which includes a pitch-pine balcony and verandah commanding views down to Durham Cathedral.
